1.title: Instructions
1.content:
Your task

In the following, your task will be to memorize a sequence of digits.

The length of this sequence can vary from one to six digits. After the presentation, we will ask you to indicate whether a certain digit was included in the sequence. Please do so by pressing y, if you think that the digit was in the set. If not, please press n.

Once you have made your decision, we will ask you to type in the entire sequence. There will be a total of sixty sequences in this experiment.

rows.title: Generate stimulus

content.text: Was this digit included in the sequence?
Was this digit included in the sequence?

9.content:
Please recall
the entire sequence in order,
as best you can.

Press Enter to continue

rows.title: Recode response
rows.code:
this.data.response = this.data.sequence_recall
  .split('')
  .filter(x => x.match(/\d/))
  .map(x => Number(x))

delete this.data.sequence_recall

this.data.correct = 
  (this.data.response.length === this.parameters.sequence.length) &&
  (this.parameters.sequence.every((x, i) => x === this.data.response[i]))

9.title: Full sequence recall

content.text: Was this digit included in the sequence?

content.text:
Please press space
to see the sequence

16.title: Thanks
16.content:
Thank you!

The experiment is now complete.

Thank you for taking the time!

You can now close this window.

metadata.title: Sternberg Paradigm
metadata.description:
Implemented following Sternberg (1966), Experiment 1, shortened slightly for demonstration purposes

Sternberg, S. (1966). High-speed scanning in human memory. Science, 153(3736), 652-654.
